page.title: 19DEVIZES WHARF.
page.content: The Kennet and Avon Canal connecting Bath with Newbury was opened in 1810. It passes through Devizes and at the Wharf two warehouses were built. In the 1840's trade dropped when the railway line and the warehouses were leased out to merchants. In the 1970's the County Council leased the area to the Kennet District Council for recreation and amenity purposes. In 1979 the Wharf Theatre established itself in the Canal Side Wharehouse.In the early 1980's the Kennet and Avon Canal Trust took over the other warehouse which now houses the Tourist Information Office, meeting rooms, a canal museum, and rooms for storage and workshops. In the Theatre plays are put on once a month.Theatre company members act there, but invited societies also perform. {(See also page 20.)}
